children.intro: Search bar core component by AppGyver

args_definition.name: value
args_definition.title: Value
args_definition.tooltip:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args_definition.description:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args_definition.name: placeholder
args_definition.title: Placeholder text
args_definition.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.
args_definition.description: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.

args_definition.name: visible
args_definition.title: Visible
args_definition.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args_definition.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args_definition.name: keyboardType
args_definition.title: Keyboard type
args_definition.tooltip:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.
args_definition.description:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.

args_definition.name: disabled
args_definition.title: Disabled
args_definition.tooltip: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.
args_definition.description: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.

args_definition.name: multiline
args_definition.title: Multiline input
args_definition.tooltip: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.
args_definition.description: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.

args_definition.name: autoCapitalize
args_definition.title: Auto-capitalize
args_definition.tooltip:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter
args_definition.description:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter

args_definition.name: secureTextEntry
args_definition.title: Password input

children.name: custom-47b5724e-a0c0-43c8-8754-70145adb0ebe
children.intro: Renders a WebView, which is essentially a borderless web browser window embedded on the page. You can use it to display an external website or other HTML content in your app, complete with ability to run JavaScript.

args_definition.name: url
args_definition.title: URL
args_definition.tooltip: Web URL to render in the WebView. If this is set, the **HTML content** property is ignored.
args_definition.description: Web URL to render in the WebView. If this is set, the **HTML content** property is ignored.

args_definition.name: html
args_definition.title: HTML content
args_definition.tooltip: Static HTML content to render in the WebView. Note that for most cases, using the **HTML view*' component is preferred, as it transpiles the HTML into React Native components rather than spinning up a whole WebVIew instance.
args_definition.description: Static HTML content to render in the WebView. Note that for most cases, using the **HTML view*' component is preferred, as it transpiles the HTML into React Native components rather than spinning up a whole WebVIew instance.

own_1a22567d.4d69a.info:
Make a HTTP request to the given URL.

In most cases, you should use **Data** in the top toolbar to configure a new REST resource instead, as that allows you to define explicit schemas for the request/response, required headers, allowed query parameters and more.

You can choose the method and customize headers for the request. For methods than GET, you can also include a request body.

If the request is successful (i.e. the response status code is within 200 range), the first output is triggered. The second output is triggered if the response status code is within the range of 400 - 500.

The third output is triggered if error occures while trying to make a HTTP request to the give URL.

The flow function returns the response body in raw text format, and as parsed JSON if possible.

By default, the `Content-Type: application/json` and `Accept: application/json` headers are included in the request.

If you change the **Request body type** to `x-www-form-urlencoded`, the `Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded` header is included instead.

To upload and download binary files, consider using the **Download file**, **Upload file** and **Upload multiple files** flow functions instead.

own_1d6d336a.9126c.info:
Create a new record to a data resource.

If the data resource is not a local resource, running this flow function will make a HTTP call to the endpoint defined in the resource configuration.
own_1d6d336a.9126c.name: Create record

arguments.name: request
arguments.title: Create data record request
arguments.description: Configuration required by the selected data resource to create a new data record.

response.name: response
response.title: Response
response.description: Response returned by the data resource after the record is successfully created.

error.name: error
error.title: Error
error.description:
One of the following error codes:

- `requestFailed`: Thrown if the entire request failed due to e.g. CORS issues or no network connectivity.
- `serverError`: Thrown if the server returned an error response.
- `resourceNotFound`: Thrown if the resouce you are trying to get was not found.
- `unknown`: Thrown if an unknown error occurred while creating the record.

own_1e592fb6.ded18.info:
Tries to open the given URL with an appropriate app. In some cases, a confirm dialog is shown before opening the URL.
  
If the URL was opened, the first output is triggered. If the user dismissed the confirm dialog, the flow execution is stopped.
  
Note that web URLs must include `http://` or `https://`.

In addition to web URLs, you can open any kind of supported URL schemes, for example `geo:37.484847,-122.148386` on Android or `http://maps.apple.com/?ll=37.484847,-122.148386` on iOS, or `tel:555123456` for initiating phone calls.
own_1e592fb6.ded18.name: Open URL

arguments.name: url
arguments.title: URL to open
arguments.description: The URL to open.

error.name: error
error.title: Error
error.description:
One of the following error codes:

- `couldNotOpenURLError`: Triggered if the URL could not be opened.

own_1fd31aef.28dcc.info: Get a single location from the device GPS sensor. By default, updates `sensorVars.geolocation.latestValue` and `sensorVars.geolocation.values`.
own_1fd31aef.28dcc.name: GPS location

arguments.name: updateSensorVars
arguments.title: Update sensor variables
arguments.description: If `true`, the new value will also be stored into `sensorVars.geolocation.latestValue` and `sensorVars.geolocation.values`.

arguments.name: enableHighAccuracy
arguments.title: High accuracy mode
arguments.description: If `true`, a GPS position will be requested. If set to `false`, a WIFI location will be requested.

value.name: value
value.title: GPS position

speed.label: Speed
speed.description: Velocity of the device, in meters per second.

heading.label: Heading
heading.description: The direction in which the device is traveling, given as degrees from true north. 0 degrees represents true north, and the direction is determined clockwise (which means that east is 90 degrees and west is 270 degrees).

accuracy.label: Accuracy
accuracy.description: Accuracy of the `latitude` and `longitude` parameters, in meters.

altitude.label: Altitude
altitude.description: Altitude of the device, in meters, relative to sea level. If the device does not provide this information, this value will be `null`.

latitude.label: Latitude
latitude.description: Latitude of the device, in decimal degrees.

longitude.label: Longitude
longitude.description: Longitude of the device, in decimal degrees.

timestamp.label: timestamp
timestamp.description: ISO 8601 timestamp of when the value was read.

altitudeAccuracy.label: Altitude accuracy
altitudeAccuracy.description: Accuracy of the `altitude` parameter, in meters.

value.description: GPS position of the device when the flow function was called.

error.name: error
error.title: Error
error.description:
One of the following error codes:

- `insecureProtocol`: Thrown when geolocation is being requested on web without using https protocol
- `unknown`: Thrown when calling the native API resulted in an unknown error.

own_20654a8f.8e704.info: Shows a non-blocking toast dialog with the given message. The dialog will disappear automatically, unless otherwise configured.
own_20654a8f.8e704.name: Toast

arguments.name: message
arguments.title: Toast message
arguments.description: Message to show on the toast dialog.

arguments.name: duration
arguments.title: Show duration
arguments.description: The duration how long the toast will be shown, in millliseconds. Leave empty to show it indefinitely.

arguments.name: position
arguments.title: Toast position
arguments.description:
The position of toast showing on screen.

A negative number represents the distance from the bottom of screen.

A positive number represents the distance form the top of screen.

0 will position the toast to the middle of screen.

arguments.name: animation
arguments.title: Animates?
arguments.description: Determines if the toast appears and disappears with a fade animation.

arguments.name: shadow
arguments.title: Has shadow?
arguments.description: Determines if the toast dialog has a drop shadow around it.

arguments.name: backgroundColor
arguments.title: Background color
arguments.description: Background color for the toast dialog.

arguments.name: shadowColor
arguments.title: Shadow color
arguments.description: Color of the toast dialog's shadow.

arguments.name: textColor
arguments.title: Text color
arguments.description: Text color for the toast dialog.

arguments.name: hideOnPress
arguments.title: Dismiss toast when pressed?
arguments.description: Determines if the user can dismiss the toast dialog by pressing on it.

arguments.name: opacity
arguments.title: Toast opacity
arguments.description: Opacity for the toast dialog. Must be between `0…1`.

own_20bb6b4f.8c11d.info:
Navigates back to the previous page by popping the current page from the navigation stack. Also closes a modal window.

Will not work if called from the root page, i.e. when there is just the single default page in the navigation stack.

If the optional **Number of pages** value is more than the current number of pages in the navigation stack, the user will be navigated back to the root page.
own_20bb6b4f.8c11d.name: Navigate back

arguments.name: numberOfPages
arguments.title: Number of pages
arguments.description: Go back more than one page.

own_9ba89f80.12e6d.info:
Get text input from the user with a blocking dialog.

The dialog has a text input field and two buttons: confirm on the right and cancel on the left.

Pressing the confirm button will trigger the first output with the entered text.

Pressing the cancel button will trigger the second output.

If an error occurs, the third output will be triggered.

Web is not supported.

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the search input, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the search input, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the search field **Value** is empty.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when the search field **Value** is empty.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to disable the search input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.
args.description: True/false value to disable the search input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.

args.name: searchIcon
args.title: Search icon name
args.tooltip: Name of the search icon.
args.description: Name of the search icon.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: backgroundImage
args.title: Background Image
args.tooltip: Background image for the container. You can configure additional display options on the Style tab.
args.description: Background image for the container. You can configure additional display options on the Style tab.

args.description: True/false value, is the toggle switch on or off?

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to set if the toggle switch is disabled. If `true`, the user cannot change the toggle switch value.
args.description: True/false value to set if the toggle switch is disabled. If `true`, the user cannot change the toggle switch value.

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the slider, represented by the slider's horizontal position

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the slider position. Similarly, if the user changes the slider position, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the slider, represented by the slider's horizontal position

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the slider position. Similarly, if the user changes the slider position, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: step
args.title: Step
args.tooltip: Minimum slider step. For example, if this value is `0.5`, possible values would include 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and so on.
args.description: Minimum slider step. For example, if this value is `0.5`, possible values would include 1, 1.5, 2, 2.5, 3 and so on.

args.name: minimumValue
args.title: Minimum value
args.tooltip:
Minimum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far left position.

For example, minimum value `1` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `1` when it's at the far left.
args.description:
Minimum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far left position.

For example, minimum value `1` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `1` when it's at the far left.

args.name: maximumValue
args.title: Maximum value
args.tooltip:
Maximum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far right position.

For example, maximum value `10` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `10` when it's at the far left.
args.description:
Maximum value for the slider's range of allowed values. This value is inclusive and represents the slider at its far right position.

For example, maximum value `10` would mean the slider's **Value** property is `10` when it's at the far left.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: Boolean to set if the slider is disabled. Input components in disabled state cannot be manipulated by the user.
args.description: Boolean to set if the slider is disabled. Input components in disabled state cannot be manipulated by the user.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible.
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.description: True/false value to set if checkbox is disabled. If `true`, the user cannot interact with the component.

args.name: checkedIcon
args.title: Checked icon
args.tooltip: Icon to show when checked.
args.description: Icon to show when checked.

args.name: uncheckedIcon
args.title: Unchecked icon
args.tooltip: Icon to show when unchecked.
args.description: Icon to show when unchecked.

args.name: value
args.title: Value
args.tooltip:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.
args.description:
Current value of the input field, i.e. what is written in the field.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any bindings are two-way. For example, if you bind a page variable to this property, changes to the page variable will change the text in the input. Similarly, if the user changes the input text, the bound page variable will follow that value.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when the input **Value** is empty.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: keyboardType
args.title: Keyboard type
args.tooltip:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.
args.description:
Keyboard type to use on mobile devices. Defaults to the basic text keyboard.

To input number values, you should use the **Number input** component instead.

args.name: disabled
args.title: Disabled
args.tooltip: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.
args.description: True/false value to disable the input field. When an input is disabled, it cannot be focused by user interaction, and text can't be inputted into it.

args.name: multiline
args.title: Multiline input
args.tooltip: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.
args.description: Allow the input to go on multiple lines.

args.name: autoCapitalize
args.title: Auto-capitalize
args.tooltip:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter
args.description:
Make the input field automatically capitalize certain characters:

- `none`: no forced capitalization
- `sentences`: sentences are forced to start with a capital letter
- `words`: words are forced to start with a capital letter
- `characters`: every character is forced into a capital letter

args.name: secureTextEntry
args.title: Password input
args.tooltip: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.
args.description: True/false value to mask the inputted text by replacing each character with a dot (•), commonly used for password input fields.

args.name: selectTextOnFocus
args.title: Select all text on focus
args.tooltip: Select all text already inputted when input is selected
args.description: Select all text already inputted when input is selected

args.name: maxLength
args.title: Maximum input length
args.tooltip: The maximum number of characters the user is allowed to input.
args.description: The maximum number of characters the user is allowed to input.

args.name: optionList
args.title: Option list
args.tooltip: The list of options available to the dropdown component, given as an array of objects with `label` and `value`.
args.description: The list of options available to the dropdown component, given as an array of objects with `label` and `value`.

args.name: value
args.title: Selected value
args.tooltip:
Value of the currently selected option.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any variable bindings are two-way. Changing the bound variable elsewhere affects the selected value, and selecting another value via the dropdown propagates the change to the bound variable.
args.description:
Value of the currently selected option.

This is an **Input property**, meaning that any variable bindings are two-way. Changing the bound variable elsewhere affects the selected value, and selecting another value via the dropdown propagates the change to the bound variable.

args.name: label
args.title: Selected label
args.tooltip:
Label of the currently selected option.

This value is determined by the **Selected value** property. Changing this property will not affect the **Selected value** property, and any changes will get overridden when a new **Selected value** is selected. In essence, this property should be treated as a read-only.
args.description:
Label of the currently selected option.

This value is determined by the **Selected value** property. Changing this property will not affect the **Selected value** property, and any changes will get overridden when a new **Selected value** is selected. In essence, this property should be treated as a read-only.

args.name: placeholder
args.title: Placeholder text
args.tooltip: Placeholder text to show when there's no value selected, i.e. **Selected value** is `null` or `undefined` or does not match any of the values in the **Option list** array.
args.description: Placeholder text to show when there's no value selected, i.e. **Selected value** is `null` or `undefined` or does not match any of the values in the **Option list** array.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: showSelectedValueAsLabel
args.title: Show value as label
args.tooltip:
If `true`, show selected value as the label in the dropdown. The dropdown options themselves will still be labels.

Useful if you e.g. want to show a dropdown of phone country codes with country name in the dropdown, but just show the selected country code when the dropdown is closed.
args.description:
If `true`, show selected value as the label in the dropdown. The dropdown options themselves will still be labels.

Useful if you e.g. want to show a dropdown of phone country codes with country name in the dropdown, but just show the selected country code when the dropdown is closed.

args.name: url
args.title: URL
args.tooltip: Web URL to render in the WebView. If this is set, the **HTML content** property is ignored.
args.description: Web URL to render in the WebView. If this is set, the **HTML content** property is ignored.

args.name: html
args.title: HTML content
args.tooltip: Static HTML content to render in the WebView. Note that for most cases, using the **HTML view*' component is preferred, as it transpiles the HTML into React Native components rather than spinning up a whole WebVIew instance.
args.description: Static HTML content to render in the WebView. Note that for most cases, using the **HTML view*' component is preferred, as it transpiles the HTML into React Native components rather than spinning up a whole WebVIew instance.

args.name: deniedUrls
args.title: Blocked URLs
args.tooltip: Array of URLs that cannot be navigated to with this WebView.
args.description: Array of URLs that cannot be navigated to with this WebView.

args.name: visible
args.title: Visible
args.tooltip: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.
args.description: True/false value to set component visibility. If `false`, the component is not rendered at all and will not take up any space.

args.name: reloadOnError
args.title: Reload on error
args.tooltip: True/false value to determine whether or not the WebView will attempt to reload the page when the onError event is triggered.
args.description: True/false value to determine whether or not the WebView will attempt to reload the page when the onError event is triggered.

args.name: scrollEnabled
args.title: Scroll enabled
args.tooltip: (iOS & MacOS) True/false value to determine whether or not the WebView content can be scrolled.
args.description: (iOS & MacOS) True/false value to determine whether or not the WebView content can be scrolled.

args.name: pullToRefreshEnabled
args.title: Pull to refresh enabled
args.tooltip: (iOS & MacOS) True/false value to determine whether or not the WebView content can be refreshed by pulling from the top.
args.description: (iOS & MacOS) True/false value to determine whether or not the WebView content can be refreshed by pulling from the top.

components.name: custom-47b5724e-a0c0-43c8-8754-70145adb0ebe
components.intro: Renders a WebView, which is essentially a borderless web browser window embedded on the page. You can use it to display an external website or other HTML content in your app, complete with ability to run JavaScript.
